Alerts & Labels

Provide contextual feedback messages for typical user actions with the handful of available and flexible alert messages. Also, documentation and examples for badges, our small count and labeling component.

Basic Alert Examples

Wrap any text and an optional dismiss button in .alert and one of the four contextual classes (e.g., .alert-success) for basic alert messages.

.alert-warning - Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit.
.alert-info - Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit.
.alert-success - Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit.
.alert-danger - Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit.

Dismissible Alerts

Build on any alert by adding an optional .alert-dismissible and close button.

Requires JavaScript alert plugin: For fully functioning, dismissible alerts, you must use the alerts JavaScript plugin.

Warning! Better check yourself, you're not looking too good.

Label Examples

Add .label-default or .label-primary modifier classes to change the appearance of a label.
